1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.1: And king Solomon reigned over all Israel:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.2: And these were the princes which he had: Azarias the son of Sadoc the priest:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.3: Elihoreph, and Ahia, the sons of Sisa, scribes: Josaphat the son of Ahilud, recorder:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.4: Banaias the son of Joiada, over the army: and Sadoc and<u>Abiathar</u>priests.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.5: Azarias the son of Nathan, over them that were about the king: Zabud, the son of Nathan the priest, the king's friend:
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.6: And Ahisar governor of the house: and Adoniram the son of Abda over the tribute.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.7: And Solomon had twelve governors over all Israel, who provided victuals for the king and for his household: for every one provided necessaries, each man his month in the year.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.8: And these are their names: Benhur, in mount Ephraim,
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.9: Bendecar, in Macces, and in Salebim, and in Bethsames, and in Elon, and in Bethanan.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.10: Benhesed in Aruboth: his was Socho, and all the land of Epher.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.11: Benabinadab, to whom belonged all Nephath-Dor, he had Tapheth the daughter of Solomon to wife.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.12: Bana the son of Ahilud, who governed Thanac and Mageddo, and all Bethsan, which is by Sarthana beneath Jezrael, from Bethsan unto Abelmehula over against Jecmaan.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.13: Bengaber in Ramoth Galaad: he had the towns of Jair the son of Manasses in Galaad, he was chief in all the country of Argob, which is in Basan, threescore great cities with walls, and brazen bolts.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.14: Abinadab the son of Addo was chief in Manaim.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.15: Achimaas in Nephtali: he also had Basemath the daughter of Solomon to wife.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.16: Baana the son of Husi, in Aser and in Baloth.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.17: Josaphat the son of Pharue, in Issachar.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.18: Semei the son of Ela in Benjamin.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.19: Gaber the son of Uri, in the land of Galaad, in the land of Sehon the king of the Amorrhites and of Og the king of Basan, over all that were in that land.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.20: Juda and Israel were innumerable, as the sand of the sea in multitude: eating and drinking, and rejoicing.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.21: And Solomon had under him all the kingdoms from<u>the river</u>to the land of the Philistines, even to the border of Egypt: and they brought him presents, and served him, all the days of his life.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.22: And the provision of Solomon for each day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal,
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.23: Ten fat oxen and twenty out of the pastures, and a hundred rams, besides venison of harts, roes, and buffles, and fatted fowls.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.24: For he had all the country which was beyond the river, from Thaphsa to Gazan, and all the kings of those countries: and he had peace on every side round about.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.25: And Juda and Israel dwelt without any fear, every one under his vine, and under his fig tree, from Dan to Bersabee, all the days of Solomon.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.26: And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of chariot horses, and twelve thousand for the saddle.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.27: And the foresaid governors of the king fed them: and they furnished the necessaries also for king Solomon's table, with great care in their time.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.28: They brought barley also and straw for the horses, and beasts, to the place where the king was, according as it was appointed them.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.29: And God gave to Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart as the sand that is on the sea shore.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.30: And the wisdom of Solomon surpassed the wisdom of all the Orientals, and of the Egyptians,
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.31: And he was wiser than all men: wiser than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Chalcol, and Dorda the sons of Mahol, and he was renowned in all nations round about.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.32: Solomon also spoke<u>three thousand parables</u>: and his poems were a thousand and five.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.33: And he treated about trees from the cedar that is in Libanus, unto the hyssop that cometh out of the wall: and he discoursed of beasts, and of fowls, and of creeping things, and of fishes.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__04.34: And they came from all nations to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and from all the kings of the earth, who heard of his wisdom.
